artefact.name: Examine
artefact.text: This area seems somewhat sanctified compared to the rest of the ruinous crypt.

CreepySkullPyro.name: Charred Skull
CreepySkullPyro.text: This charred skull seems to hold a trace of ancient essence that calls to you

CreepySkullPyro.name: Lost Essence
CreepySkullPyro.text: Feed on my embers... burn brighter... consume...

CreepySkullNormal.name: Charred Skull
CreepySkullNormal.text: There is something unsettling about this charred skull, but you can't quite place it.

StaffSmart.name: Examine
StaffSmart.text: Hmm this staff is still intact. It's pretty well made too.

StaffSmart.name: Long Staff
StaffSmart.text: It's longer and heavier, but about the same quality as my own. I don't really have a reason to take it. It'd just slow me down.

StaffBuff.name: Examine
StaffBuff.text: Hey there's a big stick over here.

StaffBuff.name: Long Staff
StaffBuff.text: It's kinda magical like my staff. But it's bigger and heavier... Which means I can hit things harder with it!

StaffBuff.name: Examine
StaffBuff.text: I'll take it. Using it will be a better workout anyways.

GhostHelp.name: Ghost
GhostHelp.text: You are a mage of some kind, no doubt trapped in this labyrinth? I sense your potential. I will aid you.

GhostHelp.name: Echo of Tera Maazara
GhostHelp.text: I am a remnant of the Astral Mage Tera Maazara. ‘She who walked between worlds’ was what they called me in life. I foresaw the downfall of this forsaken kingdom but failed to stop it. It was great hubris to believe that knowledge alone would save us from corruption. Only were it paired with wisdom could this have been averted. I hope you do not repeat my mistakes.

GhostHelp.name: Echo of Tera Maazara
GhostHelp.text:
This labyrinth was built over our ancient laboratories, you may still find remnants of our uncorrupted crystal magicks buried beneath the rubble. Use them if you can find them.

As for how to escape this maze, there are two paths to take.

GhostHelp.name: Echo of Tera Maazara
GhostHelp.text: First is through the inner sanctum of Larrathman. He is a remnant like me, but still has a physical form. He would be known to you as a lich, and has his own secret path outwards to steal corpses from the lands of the living to form these shambling abominations. You would need to destroy him to open this path.

GhostHelp.name: Echo of Tera Maazara
GhostHelp.text: The second path is through the labyrinth. Despair only exists with hope. At the end of this bloody deathtrap is an escape but it will not be an easy path to face.

GhostHelp.name: Echo of Tera Maazara
GhostHelp.text: As my final gift to you I shall teach you an abjuration of my own devising. It takes a moment to prepare, but should protect you from harm at least for a moment. Follow closely.

GhostHelp.name: Echo of Tera Maazara
GhostHelp.text: Though I am but an echo of what once was, should you escape at least my teachings will survive.

GhostHelp.name: Echo of Tera Maazara
GhostHelp.text: Before I go, should you choose to face Larrathman, let him know that it was Maazara who spelled his doom.

GhostHelp.name: Gift of Maazara
GhostHelp.text: The Echo of Tera Maazara fades, but you are left with the last vestige of her power.

GhostShun.name: Ghost
GhostShun.text: I sense the taint of dark pyromancies within you. I will not help you escape this place.

DiarySmart.name: Examine
DiarySmart.text: This explorer seems to have left a journal of some kind.

DiarySmart.name: Diary
DiarySmart.text: I am done for. And I will not allow the shamblers to turn me into one of them. Before I take my own life with a final spell I will record what I know in my diary so that should another apprentice of the Arcanum overcome the Malevolent spirit that guards this place, perhaps they can avoid my fate.

DiarySmart.name: Diary
DiarySmart.text: I call this place the Blood Maze. Some powerful undead wizard appears to have constructed it over a previous structure from the Old Kingdom.

DiarySmart.name: Diary
DiarySmart.text: It creates these Shambling undead out of fresh corpses. I don’t know where they come from. They autonomously build and rebuild this place. The Maze itself is a deathtrap, with monsters around every corner, dead ends and illusions.

DiarySmart.name: Diary
DiarySmart.text: To the north is a Rune Door. I cannot seem to cast my arcane energies fast enough to overcome the lock. Furthermore, the Rune Door itself seems to absorb magical energies making it stronger. To strike at the door with magic is to strengthen the arcane lock. No man is strong enough to break through sheer force.

DiarySmart.name: Diary
DiarySmart.text: I wish I had solutions for you, but I do not. The only sense of hope I can instill upon you is that there seems to be another presence within the Blood Maze, and I do not think it wishes me harm. If only I could find it.

DiaryBuff.name: Examine
DiaryBuff.text: I can’t really read, but this looks important. I may as well try.

DiaryBuff.name: Examine
DiaryBuff.text: I give up. I'd be better suited to breaking down these walls brick by brick.

spellbookj.name: Examine
spellbookj.text: This tome is full of awesome arcane knowledge! Too bad I can't read.

spellbooks.name: Examine
spellbooks.text: This tome is full of awesome arcane knowledge! The documentation is so outdated though.

choicesText: Leave the knowledge, it might be dangerous.

testDialogue.name: Mentor
testDialogue.text: You're not going to stop training.

testDialogue.name: Mentor
testDialogue.text: You must keep up or you will fail!

Dummy.name: Mentor
Dummy.text: The time will soon be upon you, my young apprentice for you to go on your The Quest of Initiation, a test of your magical mettle against truly fearsome foes. I will not be able to accompany you on this journey, although I will keep in contact with my scrying to keep an eye on you.

Dummy.name: Mentor
Dummy.text: I have prepared a simple refresher course to reacquaint you with the mystic arts.

Dummy.name: Mentor
Dummy.text: Let’s start simple with the basics of conjuring arcane energies. Simply click to charge an arcane blast and fire it at the target dummy!

DummyBrawn.name: Mentor
DummyBrawn.text: Uhm. That… wasn’t an arcane blast. Well I’m sure you understand the concept, let’s move on. There are some problems that cannot be solved with brute force. Try this runic seal puzzle.

DummyMagic.name: Mentor
DummyMagic.text: Well done! But remember, whatever beasts the Immortal Malevolents of the Old Kingdom send at you won’t be stationary! Let’s move on. There are some problems that cannot be solved with brute force. It requires a honed mind! Take for example this Runic Seal puzzle

DoorBrawn.name: Mentor
DoorBrawn.text: No no no! I just said there are problems you can’t solve with brute force!! Hmph, Nevermind. Just read the scrolls I owled you this week. This last part is the most important lesson anyways.

DoorMagic.name: Mentor
DoorMagic.text: Fantastic! You are truly my top student. Let’s move on.

FinalChoice.name: Mentor
FinalChoice.text: Well. Finally and most importantly a wizard must have the wisdom to choose the right course of action. As my final advice to you I suggest you head to the library to study before you set off on your quest. Best of luck my young apprentice.
